From: Noah Levitt <nlevitt@...>

Unfortunately not. The rule of thumb is that if it's something that
require=
s some action to take effect besides merely setting the value,
then changin=
g it will have no effect. Typically such an action happens
automatically wh=
en the crawl starts, but it doesn't happen
automatically when you change a =
value in the bean browser. It's not
necessarily obvious when that's the cas=
e, of course. The bean browse
and edit functionality is very powerful and l=
ow level, but also sort
of dumb, in its ignorance of what's useful.

The ac=
tion directory should always work though. So when there's
something you wan=
t to do mid-crawl, maybe find out first if it's
possible via the action dir=
ectory. If not, you can try the bean
browser. And if that doesn't work, you=
 can do just about anything with
the scripting console, but that takes some=
 understanding of the source
code.

Noah
